business.headline: Dubai's billionaire realty map: Can India's salaried class invest there?For years, Dubai's skyline has glittered like a dream, much like that tempting NRI cousin who always seemed a step ahead in life. But things are changing as salaried Indians are looking to venture into Dubai's posh real estate.
Sensex closes 123 points higher, Nifty above 25,100; HCLTech gains 3%The S&P BSE Sensex added 123.42 points to end at 82,515.14, while the NSE Nifty gained 37.15 points to close at 25,141.40.

Bharat rising: Why Tier-2 cities drive job growth, explains HireVeda co-founderWhile the metros still lead in the number of jobs, the speed of growth in smaller cities is hard to ignore, noted co-founder of HireVeda and ExecEdge.

India now home to over 85,000 millionaires, ranks 4th globally: ReportIndia now trails only the United States, China, and Japan in terms of the number of wealthy individuals, accounting for 3.7% of the global HNWI population.

Digital Form 16: Step-by-step guide to download and use it for easy ITR filingWith the advent of digital platforms, accessing and using Form 16 has become more straightforward, making it a vital document for accurate and hassle-free income tax return (ITR) filing.

Chasing Rs 10 discounts? CA explains why tracking every rupee isn't making you richIt's a common belief that managing every rupee wisely equals financial discipline. People cut back on little indulgences and chase discounts, feeling financially in control, yet, their money may be slipping away in unnoticed ways.

'Make in India' gave us breakthrough in defence, says Bharat Forge's Baba Kalyani"A lot of army guys walked by, some laughed at it," Chairman Baba Kalyani said during an episode of the New India Junction podcast  "Not a single guy stopped to even see what the hell it was."

Paramount to cut 3.5% of US jobs as cable TV declines: ReportThis is not the first round of job losses at Paramount. Back in August last year, the company had already cut 15% of its workforce, indicating ongoing adjustments in response to market changes.

Law tribunal clears merger of Inox Wind Energy Limited with Inox WindThe merger is expected to reduce liabilities by around Rs 2,050 crore. The company also expects to save costs by improving how resources are used and by simplifying various processes.
Sensex opens 86 points higher, Nifty above 25,100; RIL gains 1%The S&P BSE Sensex gained 104.24 points to 82,495.96, while the NSE Nifty50 added 36.70 points to 25,140.95 as of 9:31 am.

Oswal Pumps IPO to open soon with Rs 1,387 crore target. Check detailsOswal Pumps is launching an IPO aiming to raise Rs 1,387.34 crore. Here are essential details potential investors need to consider before subscribing.

Tariff cuts, easing digital barriers: India, US make headway in trade talksBoth nations are aiming for an interim trade pact by the end of June, before the pause on Trump's proposed tariffs expires. India is advocating for full exemption from a 26% reciprocal tariff on domestic goods.

entertainment.headline: Nandamuri Balakrishna's knife flip goes viral from his 65th birthday bashActor and MLA Nandamuri Balakrishna celebrated his 65th birthday on June 10 with massive fanfare across Andhra Pradesh and Telangana. As large numbers of people gathered at a location, the actor warmly interacted with fans, posing for selfies and joining in the celebrations.

Panchayat 4 trailer reactions: Fans say life is good againFans gave a thumbs up to the trailer of 'Panchayat Season 4', which was released by the makers on June 11.  The social media users expressed their excitement and shared how they couldn't wait any longer for the series.

Kesari Chapter 2 on OTT: When and where to watch Akshay Kumar's courtroom dramaAkshay Kumar's 'Kesari Chapter 2' is set to stream on Jio Hotstar from June 13. The film also stars R Madhavan and Ananya Panday in key roles.

Housefull 5 turns animal cruelty into comedy, and it's uglyIn 'Housefull 5', a digitally-created parrot is relentlessly thrashed and beaten for cheap laughs. But when did beating a parrot become a joke? When did we decide that it was funny?

Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi 2 to premiere on July 3: Reports'Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi 2' will reportedly premiere on July 3. The show's first episode aired on the same day 25 years ago. Ekta Kapoor's father Jeetendra is also likely to make an appearance in the sequel.

Rahul Vaidya says Virat Kohli's brother called him after Instagram controversySinger Rahul Vaidya shared that Virat Kohli's brother, Vikas Kohli, contacted him after his controversial remarks involving the cricketer. Vikas advised Rahul to focus on his singing instead of seeking publicity through Virat's name.

Rapper Kanye West renames himself from Ye to Ye Ye: ReportRapper Kanye West, popularly known as Ye, has updated his legal name. He will now be referred to as 'Ye Ye', as per his name in the new California business filings.

Did Shilpa Shetty scream at a tourist in Croatia? Raj Kundra reacts to viral videoActor Shilpa Shetty and her family were involved in an argument at a restaurant in Croatia after their reserved table was given to someone else. The video has since gone viral. Her husband, Raj Kundra, explained that the incident spoiled Shilpa's birthday celebration.

Let Her Go singer Passenger announces 3-city India tour. DetailsEnglish singer-songwriter Passenger is making his much-awaited India debut this year. The 'Let Her Go' hitmaker announced a three-city tour in November.

Jr NTR joins Trivikram's mythological fantasy film, producer shares cryptic postAfter much anticipation around Allu Arjun's reunion with director Trivikram Srinivas, reports now suggest a major shift. Jr NTR is reportedly set to play the lead in the long-discussed socio-mythological epic.

Celebration begins: Suriya and director Venky Atluri film goes on floorsDirected by Venky Atluri, the shooting of Tamil actor Suriya's upcoming film, tentatively titled 'Suriya 46', has begun. The film also stars 'Premalu' fame Mamitha Baiju.

Arbaaz Khan confirms wife Sshura's pregnancy with nervousness and excitementActor and producer Arbaaz Khan confirmed that he and his wife, Sshura Khan, are expecting a baby. He said his priority now is to be a present and be a supportive parent.

Ranbir Kapoor enjoys foosball match with Aamir Khan's son, Azad. WatchActor Ranbir Kapoor can be seen enjoying a match of foosball with Aamir Khan's son Azad in a viral video on social media. The actor recently attended a special screening of 'Sitaare Zameen Par' at Aamir's residence.

Actor Chum Darang condemns hate against Northeast after Raja Raghuvanshi murderActor Chum Darang, in a social media post, addressed the uproar over Raja Raghuvanshi's murder and defended crimes in Northeast India.

Karan Johar criticises Bollywood's herd mentality: We need unique ideasFilmmaker Karan Johar recently spoke about the herd mentality in Bollywood where everyone attempts to mimic successful films like 'Pushpa', 'Stree' and 'Chhaava'. He also reflected on the new trend of cinematic universes.

Panchayat 4 trailer: Manju Devi vs Kranti Devi brings fun and frustration to PhuleraIn 'Panchayat Season 4', a lot seems to be at stake with the election battle underway. As Manju Devi and Kranti Devi indulge in a tough fight, Sachiv ji once again finds himself in the middle of the village chaos.

Malayalam film Premalu 2, starring Naslen and Mamitha Baiju, delayed. Here's whyThe sequel to the 2024 blockbuster Malayalam film starring Naslen and Mamitha Baiju, 'Premalu 2', has been delayed. Producer Dileesh Pothan confirmed the same during a recent interview.

Wonder Woman 3 confirmed: Director James Gunn says slow but movingGood news DC fans! James Gunn has officially confirmed a new Wonder Woman film. In an interview, he said that the film is currently in work.

TV actors Puja Banerjee-Kunal Verma duped by close friend: We are back to zeroTV couple Puja Banerjee and Kunal Verma recently revealed that they were robbed of their entire savings by a close friend. They shared how the two are forced to start from zero now.

general news.headline: 100% sure she did it: Sonam's brother blames her for Meghalaya honeymoon murderSonam's brother, who spoke to reporters in Indore after meeting Raja's mother, said while she hasn't confessed to the murder, the evidence that has emerged so far points to her direct involvement.

Parde mein rehne do: Pakistan's cover-up operation after Sindoor strikesFresh high-resolution satellite images analysed by India Today show Pakistan is now using tarpaulins to cover at least three military sites hit during India's Operation Sindoor.

Bengaluru stampede an accident: Mallikarjun Kharge hits at BJP over Kumbh, CovidCalling the June 4 Bengaluru stampede an accident, Congress president Mallikarjun Kharge said action will be taken if there were any intentional missteps found. Kharge's comment comes amidst the demand for resignations of Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah, Deputy Chief Minister DK Shivakumar and Home Minister G Parameshwara.
When will Ax-4 Mission with India's Shubhanshu Shukla launch?The mission which was supposed to launch on May 29 has seen repeated delays until Wednesday due to weather and technical issues.

Trump can't broker peace between his ego and reality, forget about India-Pak ceasefireFrom his trade war dud against China to burning his fingers in the Ukraine-Russia war to his fake claims of brokering India-Pak ceasefire to stoking fire in Los Angeles, it's a global Donald Trump clown show in the White House. And we are running out of patience and popcorn.

Zohran Mamdani turns New York City mayoral race into Bollywood blockbusterZohran Mamdani has leaned into his South Asian heritage and captured the attention of younger, immigrant, and working-class New Yorkers with his populist platform and savvy use of Hindi film nostalgia.

Don't even drink Royal Challenge: DK Shivakumar denies rumours of buying RCBKarnataka Deputy Chief Minister DK Shivakumar has denied rumours of buying the RCB franchise, saying he has no time for it. His clarification comes after 11 people died in a stampede at an RCB event. Shivakumar even joked, "I don't even drink Royal Challenge."

Video: Have mercy, mother appeals to another on live TV in honeymoon murder caseAs the Meghalaya honeymoon murder probe deepens, an emotional face-off unfolded on India Today between the mothers of the accused and the victim, laying personal grief, blame, and a demand for justice.
What happens when you cut sugar from your diet for 30 daysCan a 30-day sugar break improve physical and mental health? Here's what experts say.

Bros again? Elon Musk's posts spark buzz of 'big, beautiful' patch up with TrumpElon Musk just hit the brakes on his Trump feud, saying he regrets his online attacks and suddenly, he's re-following allies, deleting dirt, and backing the former president's stance on LA riots. Is a Musk–Trump reunion brewing, or just the calm before the next tweetstorm?

Dubai's billionaire realty map: Can India's salaried class invest there?For years, Dubai's skyline has glittered like a dream, much like that tempting NRI cousin who always seemed a step ahead in life. But things are changing as salaried Indians are looking to venture into Dubai's posh real estate.

Man hugs, kisses women out on walk in Bengaluru park; dares them to report himA man allegedly assaulted two women near Milton Park in Bengaluru, triggering safety concerns. Police have registered a case under Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita and begun investigation.

Panchayat 4 trailer reactions: Fans say life is good againFans gave a thumbs up to the trailer of 'Panchayat Season 4', which was released by the makers on June 11.  The social media users expressed their excitement and shared how they couldn't wait any longer for the series.

Liquid oxygen leak hits Indian astronaut's launch: What went wrong?SpaceX announced on Wednesday, hours before the planned launch, that the teams require more time to repair the LOx (Liquid-oxygen) leak identified during post-static fire booster inspections.

Sonam had Plan B. Fresh details emerge in Meghalaya honeymoon murder caseAfter returning to her maternal home in Indore just four days after her wedding, Sonam Raghuvanshi allegedly began plotting her husband's murder and coordinating the plan with her lover over calls.
Why India is spending ₹500 cr on Axiom-4India's ₹500 crore investment in the Axiom-4 mission covers not just one, but two astronauts.

Misal, Chole Bhature make India proud. Desi breakfasts crack TasteAtlas' Top 50In its latest edition of the 50 Best Breakfasts in the World, food guide TasteAtlas has named three Indian staples among the top contenders: Misal, Chole Bhature, and Paratha.

Invited whole world: Karnataka blames BCCI, RCB in court for Bengaluru stampedeAs the Karnataka High Court hears bail pleas in the Bengaluru stampede case, the state blames RCB and BCCI, alleging unauthorised planning, misinformation, and gross mismanagement that led to 11 deaths.

We're not saints: Ajit Pawar defends BJP tie-up as NCP merger buzz growsNCP's 26th foundation day saw separate events by Ajit Pawar and Supriya Sule, both focusing on development amid rising merger talks between the two factions.

WTC Final 2025 Day 1: Pressure on Smith as Rabada, Jansen rock AussiesAustralia vs South Africa Live Score, World Test Championship Final 2025 Updates: Marco Jansen breaks the partnership of Steve Smith and Marnus Labuschagne as he gets the new opener with a brilliant delivery. The Proteas are on top at the moment and the Aussies are dependent on Smith to save them.
Strawberry Moon to rise tonight: Don't miss watching it for this reasonThe moon will appear slightly larger and brighter due to its proximity to perigee — the point in its orbit closest to Earth.

Caught on CCTV: Advocate collapses while talking in Lucknow, dies seconds laterSeveral lawyers accompanying him reported that he had suddenly collapsed while working in the office. The entire incident was recorded by the CCTV cameras installed in the tehsil.

Letting children go so far...: Mohan Yadav's takeaway from Sonam Raghuvanshi caseMadhya Pradesh Chief Minister Mohan Yadav weighed in on the murder of Raja Raghuvanshi, calling the case a "lesson to society" and urging parents to reconsider allowing their children to travel far from home.

Indo-Canadians nabbed for smuggling Rs 300 crore cocaine into CanadaNine people, including several Indo-Canadians, have been arrested as the Peel Regional Police seized 479 kg of cocaine worth CAD 47.9 million (Rs 299.4 crore). Under its Project Pelican, the agency targeted the smuggling of cocaine through commercial trucks crossing from the US into Canada's Greater Toronto Area. Two semi-automatic loaded firearms were also recovered from the smugglers.

sports.headline: Kalyan Chaubey destroyed Indian football: Bhaichung Bhutia demands overhaulFormer India captain Bhaichung Bhutia has accused the Indian football federation of destroying the sport after India suffered a 1-0 defeat against Hong Kong at Kowloon's Kai Tak Sports Park.

Virat Kohli's aura and chirping will be a big miss for India at slips : Ollie PopeStar England batter Ollie Pope feels India will miss the presence of Virat Kohli in the slips during the all-important five-match Test series against England beginning from June 20.

WTC Final: Pat Cummins feels no extra pressure ahead of clash vs South AfricaPat Cummins says Australia feels no extra pressure ahead of the WTC final versus South Africa. Both teams are confident and ready to compete in a thrilling contest at Lord's with South Africa opting to field first after winning the toss.

Rishabh Pant sends special message to Nicholas Pooran after retirement callRishabh Pant paid a glowing tribute to Nicholas Pooran after the West Indies star announced his shock retirement from international cricket on June 10. Pant and Pooran played together at LSG.

WTC Final 2025 Day 1: Pressure on Smith as Rabada, Jansen rock AussiesAustralia vs South Africa Live Score, World Test Championship Final 2025 Updates: Marco Jansen breaks the partnership of Steve Smith and Marnus Labuschagne as he gets the new opener with a brilliant delivery. The Proteas are on top at the moment and the Aussies are dependent on Smith to save them.

Ganguly unhappy with Shreyas Iyer's absence from Tests: He can play short ballFormer India captain Sourav Ganguly is unhappy with Shreyas Iyer's absence from the Indian Test team despite his remarkable performances in recent times.

What makes Cummins a special captain? Harbhajan explains ahead of WTC FinalHarbhajan Singh praised Pat Cummins and explained what makes the pacer a special captain ahead of the World Test Championship Final against South Africa, which will begin on June 11. Cummins is chasing his second WTC title as skipper of Australia.

WTC Final 2025: How much money will India get for finishing third in the cycle?South Africa and Australia are set to lock horns in the World Test Championship (WTC) final 2025 at Lord's in London. Despite not being in the final for the first time in WTC, India will be taking home hefty prize money for finishing third on the points table.

After international retirement, Nicholas Pooran named captain of MI New YorkJust a day after his international cricket retirement, Nicholas Pooran has been named as the captain of MI New York ahead of the MLC 2025 season. Pooran retired from all formats for West Indies on June 10.

It's going to be tough against Australia but we've got to believe in us: Temba BavumaSouth Africa captain Temba Bavuma has acknowledged that it's going to be tough for their team to face Australia in the World Test Championship (WTC) final 2025. However, the Proteas captain has faith in his team's strength to come out on top of in the all-important clash beginning from June 20 at the Lord's.

However, the Proteas captain has faith in his team's strength to come out on top of in the all-important clash beginning from June 20 at the Lord's.

Hope returns, King gets 1st call-up as West Indies announce squad for AUS TestsShai Hope returns to the West Indies Test squad while Brandon King earns his maiden call-up for the upcoming series against Australia. The team aims to bridge the gap with fresh talent and strategic leadership under new captain Roston Chase.

Virat Kohli was unbelievable in helping me out at RCB: Jacob BethellStar England all-rounder Jacob Bethell has revealed that Indian batting stalwart Virat Kohli helped him out immensely during his stint at Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) in the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025).

WTC Final, South Africa vs Australia weather report: Will rain spoil the party at Lord's?Australia and South Africa meet at Lord's for the World Test Championship final starting June 11. With fans expecting a thrilling contest for the mace, will rain play spoilsport across the five days in London?

Pat Cummins on Scott Boland's exclusion from WTC final: He isn't running out of timeAustralia captain Pat Cummins said that Scott Boland was unlucky to miss out from the playing XI for the World Test Championship (WTC) final 2025 against South Africa.

No fear of failure in Australia, just want to play well and win: Pat CumminsAustralia captain Pat Cummins has fired a warning to South Africa ahead of the World Test Championship (WTC) final in 2025, saying that there's no fear of failure in their side ahead of the big clash. South Africa and Australia are set to lock horns in the WTC final from June 11 at Lord's.

England complete 3-0 sweep after Duckett, Wood star in high-scoring 3rd T20IEngland completed a 3-0 whitewash over West Indies with a 37-run victory in the third T20I. Ben Duckett was adjudged Player of the Match for his brilliant innings of 84 (46) while Jos Buttler was adjudged Player of the Series.

WTC final preview: South Africa chase respect and glory against mighty AussiesWTC 2025 final preview: South Africa eye a defining triumph as they battle for respect on Test cricket's grandest stage. Standing in their way: defending champions Australia, chasing an era-defining victory at Lord's, London.

WTC final Australia vs South Africa: All the FAQs answeredSouth Africa and Australia head into the WTC Final with contrasting journeys but shared ambitions. As they meet at Lord's, it's a chance to settle scores and stake claim to Test cricket's biggest prize.

South Africa and Australia are set to lock horns in the WTC final from June 11 at Lord's.

WTC final: Pat Cummins won't be surprised if English fans support South AfricaAustralia captain Pat Cummins said he anticipates the neutrals and a lot of English supporters to back South Africa in the World Test Championship final at Lord's, London.

Parth Jindal calls for new manager after India's unacceptable Hong Kong lossIndia's 0-1 defeat to Hong Kong in the Asian Cup Qualifiers has triggered fresh outrage, with Bengaluru FC owner Parth Jindal publicly calling for a managerial overhaul and urgent action from the All India Football Federation.

MS Dhoni, new ICC Hall of Famer, felicitated by Jharkhand cricket body in RanchiJharkhand State Cricket Association president, Ajay Nath Shahdeo, met MS Dhoni in person in Ranchi after the state body held a special ceremony to celebrate the former captain's induction into ICC Hall of Fame.

Pat Cummins explains Sam Konstas' snub from WTC Final: Has a long career aheadAustralia captain Pat Cummins assured that Sam Konstas' Test future still has a long way to pan out despite WTC Final exclusion. Marnus Labuschagne got nod to open against South Africa at Lord's over Konstas.

Rohan Bopanna out of top 50 for 1st time in 15 years, Nagal slips below 200Sumit Nagal is India's highest-ranked men's singles player, but he has dropped below 200 in the latest ATP rankings. Meanwhile, Rohan Bopanna, who was ranked No. 1 lat year, has dropped out of the top 50 for the first time since 2010 in men's doubles.

India lose 0-1 to Hong Kong as pressure rises on coach Manolo MarquezIndia head coach Manolo Marquez found the pressure on him and his future at the role rise as his side lost 1-0 to Hong Kong in their AFC Asian Cup Qualifiers clash on June 10, which only stretches their recent run of disastrous form.

How Kagiso Rabada regained Proteas dressing room's trust after drugs banSouth Africa captain Temba Bavuma said both the dressing room and Kagiso Rabada have moved on from the episode involving his drugs ban. Rabada will lead the Proteas' bowling attack in the World Test Championship final against Australia at Lord's, London.

AS Roma manager Claudio Ranieri rejects Italy head coach job for Seire A stayClaudio Ranieri has officially declined the chance to take over as Italy's national team head coach, choosing instead to continue his commitment to AS Roma in an advisory capacity. With Ranieri out of contention, the FIGC has now turned its attention to former AC Milan boss Stefano Pioli.

Australia announce XI for WTC final, Labuschagne picked as makeshift openerAustralia have named a makeshift opener and two medium pace all-rounders for the WTC final against South Africa at Lord's. Cameron Green returns to the XI and he will play at No. 3, confirmed captain Pat Cummins on Tuesday, June 10.

No surprises as South Africa name playing XI for WTC Final vs AustraliaSouth Africa enter the WTC Final with a settled, in-form squad — hoping their consistent selection and a balance of youth and experience will help overcome Pat Cummins' Australia at the historic Lord's Cricket Ground.

Stampede in Bengaluru during RCB celebrations very disappointing: Rahul DravidRahul Dravid expressed anguish over the tragic stampede during RCB's IPL victory celebrations in Bengaluru. 11 people were killed and over 50 injured in the stampede, which has raised serious concerns over crowd management capabilities of the city.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
